name: chatgpt_prod_hospital_gdb_fz_pivot
description: [GPT Prod] Hospital sterile ward + GDB FZ ‚Üí pivot to GDMI-ZM (hygiene)
query: We are upgrading the air handling units supplying sterile wards in a hospital. We initially selected GDB 600x600 in standard Galvanized (FZ). Required airflow is 3,400 m¬≥/h per housing. Installation is indoors in a technical room. Please confirm if this configuration is suitable and provide the product code.

turns.content: We are upgrading the air handling units supplying sterile wards in a hospital. We initially selected GDB 600x600 in standard Galvanized (FZ). Required airflow is 3,400 m¬≥/h per housing. Installation is indoors in a technical room. Please confirm if this configuration is suitable and provide the product code.

For the sterile wards upgrade project in the hospital, the GDB 600x600 housing in Galvanized (FZ) is not suitable.The GDB family uses bolted construction and is not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installation due to hygiene requirements. Bolted construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for ENV_HOSPITAL environments.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified that the GDB product family (single-wall, uninsulated) is unsuitable for hospital sterile wards due to hygiene and condensation risks. It correctly recommended the GDMI family (double-wall, insulated) which is the appropriate product for this application. The airflow sizing (3400 m¬≥/h for 600x600) aligns with the nominal capacity listed in the PDF.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Verified GDB is 'oisolerat enkelv√§ggsutf√∂rande' (PDF p.8) and GDMI is 'isolerat dubbelmantlad' (PDF p.11), confirming the hygiene suitability logic.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response addresses the unsuitability, explains why, and provides the correct alternative family.
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly blocks a single-wall uninsulated housing for a sterile ward application where condensation and hygiene are critical risks.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Sound engineering logic connecting construction type (single vs double wall) to application requirements (hygiene/leakage).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Respects the implied application limits of the basic GDB range vs the high-spec GDMI range.

strengths: Accurate identification of application risks (Sterile Ward vs Single-wall housing)
Correct mapping of airflow (3400 m¬≥/h) to module size (600x600) implicitly acknowledged
Clear recommendation of the correct product family (GDMI)
pdf_citations: GDB levereras i oisolerat enkelv√§ggsutf√∂rande (PDF p.8)
GDMI levereras i isolerat dubbelmantlad utf√∂rande (PDF p.11)
Ett riktm√§rke √§r t.ex. 3400m¬≥/h per modul (592x592) (PDF p.3)

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies GDB 600x600 with 3,400 m¬≥/h airflow (matches PDF p.9) and raises a valid concern about hospital hygiene requirements. However, the block reasoning is questionable ‚Äî GDB is a standard duct filter housing and the PDF does not explicitly restrict it from hospital use; the claim about 'bolted construction' not meeting hygiene requirements is not substantiated by the catalog. The response also fails to provide a complete alternative recommendation with product code, sizing, or material details for the suggested GDMI.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDB 600x600 airflow of 3,400 m¬≥/h is confirmed on PDF p.9; however, the claim that GDB uses 'bolted construction' unsuitable for hospitals is not supported by the catalog ‚Äî GDB is described as a standard duct filter housing with single-wall uninsulated construction, and the PDF makes no mention of hospital environment restrictions for any product family.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system blocks the original selection but fails to provide a complete alternative ‚Äî no GDMI product code, no sizing confirmation, no material recommendation, and no weight or length options are given.
dimension_explanations.safety: Raising hygiene concerns for sterile hospital wards is sound engineering practice ‚Äî hospital ventilation systems do require higher leakage class and cleanability standards, making the concern directionally valid even if the specific block mechanism is debatable.
dimension_explanations.tone: The response uses internal system labels like 'ENV_HOSPITAL' and '[WARNING: Blocked]' which are not appropriate for customer-facing technical consultation.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The cause-effect chain (hospital ‚Üí hygiene requirements ‚Üí bolted construction unsuitable) has some engineering basis but lacks specificity ‚Äî it doesn't cite which leakage class or hygiene standard is violated, and the PDF doesn't distinguish GDB as 'bolted' vs GDMI as meeting hospital requirements.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: The system applies an environment constraint (hospital) that is not explicitly defined in the product catalog, which may be overly conservative ‚Äî GDMI is insulated and double-walled which is arguably better for hygiene, but the catalog doesn't formally restrict GDB from hospital use.

strengths: Correctly identifies GDB 600x600 airflow capacity of 3,400 m¬≥/h
Raises a directionally valid concern about hygiene requirements for sterile hospital wards ‚Äî GDMI's double-walled insulated construction is indeed more appropriate for such environments
weaknesses: Blocks the configuration without providing a complete alternative recommendation (no product code, material, sizing, or weight for GDMI)

Uses internal system terminology (ENV_HOSPITAL, WARNING: Blocked) in customer-facing output, and the specific claim about 'bolted construction' being the disqualifying factor is not substantiated by the catalog
Does not mention that GDMI is not available in stainless steel (RF) per PDF p.11, which could be relevant for hospital hygiene discussions
pdf_citations: GDB is described as 'oisolerat enkelv√§ggsutf√∂rande' (uninsulated single-wall) for indoor use (PDF p.8)
GDMI is described as 'v√§rme- och kondensisolerat modulfiltersk√•p' in ZM material, not available in RF (PDF p.11)
GDMI 600x600: Fl√∂de = 3,400 m¬≥/h, available in lengths 600/650 and 850/900 (PDF p.12)

reasoning_paths.path: Material locked to FZ -> Filter 600x600mm -> Sized to 600x600 -> Code: GDB-600x600-R-PG-FZ

content_segments.text: For the sterile wards upgrade project in the hospital, the GDB 600x600 housing in Galvanized (FZ) is not suitable.

The GDB family uses bolted construction and is not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installation due to hygiene requirements. Bolted construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.
content_segments.inference_logic: Product not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses BOLTED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for ENV_HOSPITAL environments.
